comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Herbert Gallop painted a picture looking the other way from behind the building far right. The NLA has it dated "ca.1925", but it must be slightly after this photo in May 1927.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Princes St was supposed to be quite posh but it doesnt look like it here.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32162360@N00] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/35179849@N08]  When they built the bridge they also demolished the congregation at St Philip's and Holy Trinity Churches. It's only now that apartments have appeared in York, Clarence and Kent Streets that the congregations are growing significantly. Barangaroo will change the character of this corner of Sydney yet again.
